accussed_details.name: TAJA
allegation: Fraudulent deprivation of valuable land during consolidation operations

complaint_summary: The respondent alleged fraudulent deprivation of valuable land measuring 7 Kanals 6 Marlas during consolidation operations, claiming the involvement of field staff and forged thumb-impressions.
investigation_summary: The court examined the record, including resolutions with thumb-impressions, and found evidence of fraud and collusion by the consolidation staff. The respondent's possession of the disputed land was confirmed.
judgment_summary: The court rejected the revision petition, affirming the Additional Commissioner’s decision that the appeal was not time-barred due to fraud. The respondent was deemed to have been deprived of valuable land unjustly.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued the appeal was time-barred and the respondent consented to the allocation of land.
Respondent argued fraud in consolidation operations and deprivation of valuable land, supported by legal precedents (PLD 1969 Lahore 365, 1988 SCMR 1449).

assets.description: Land measuring 7 Kanals 6 Marlas in Khasra No.1172/419
Land in Khasra No.343 (8 Kanals 18 Marlas)
assets.location: Joint ownership, partially owned by TAJA

witness_statement.Patwari: Confirmed respondent’s possession of disputed land and fraudulent actions during consolidation operations.

key_issues: Fraudulent deprivation of land during consolidation operations

maxims.Estoppel: Party obliging Court by conduct to adopt course contrary to Court's practice cannot subsequently raise objection to such course.

words_and_phrases.Consolidation Scheme: A process of reorganizing land ownership and allocation in a village.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around allegations of fraud during land consolidation operations, with the respondent claiming deprivation of valuable land due to forged thumb-impressions and collusion by field staff. The court upheld the Additional Commissioner’s decision, rejecting the revision petition and confirming the respondent’s possession of the disputed land.
